comments:
Hi,

I try to mirror the callisto update site for an internal intranet use and got a HTTP 404 error:

Command-line arguments: -application org.eclipse.update.core.standaloneUpdate -comm
and mirror -to /srv/www/eclipse/callisto/update -from http://ftp-stud.
fht-esslingen.de/pub/Mirrors/eclipse/callisto/releases/ -mirrorURL http://mirror-internal/eclipse/callisto/update

!ENTRY org.eclipse.update.core 4 0 Jul 02, 2006 22:33:39.360
!MESSAGE Unable to retrieve remote reference "http://ftp-stud.fht-esslingen.de/pub/
Mirrors/eclipse/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.2.0.v-671.jar". [h
ttp://ftp-stud.fht-esslingen.de/pub/Mirrors/eclipse/callisto/releases/plugins/org.e
clipse.jdt.core_3.2.0.v-671.jar]
!STACK 0
java.io.FileNotFoundException: http://ftp-stud.fht-esslingen.de/pub/Mirrors/eclipse
/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.2.0.v-671.jar
        at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(HttpURLConnec
tion.java:812)
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.HttpResponse.getInputStream(HttpRespons
e.java:35)

I tried multiple mirrors and they failed all at the same point of jar.

Regards,
Dirk
Note that "org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.2.0.v-671.jar" is not the correct name for JDT/Core plugin. It should be "org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.2.0.v_671.jar" instead...
The webmaster is responsible for mirror issues, not platform releng

Sorry, I didn't read this bug propertly the first time.  Are you saying that you are trying to mirror that one jar and it didn't complete.  The jar is
actually called 

org.eclipse.jdt.core_3.2.0.v_671.jar

and this name is accurately reflected in the feature.  

Or are you saying that you were trying to mirror the entire site using the update command line arguments and it tried to fetch the wrong version of the jdt.core jar?  If so, what version of eclipse are you using to run the command line utilities?

(In reply to comment #4)

> 
> Or are you saying that you were trying to mirror the entire site using the
> update command line arguments and it tried to fetch the wrong version of the
> jdt.core jar?  If so, what version of eclipse are you using to run the command
> line utilities?
> 
I try to mirror the entire site using eclipse standaloneUpdate

java -cp startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main -application org.eclipse.update
.core.standaloneUpdate -command mirror -to $MIRROR_DIR -from $SRC_URL -mirrorURL $MIRROR_URL 

name=Eclipse Platform

id=org.eclipse.platform

version=3.0.1

On Linux. The eclipse version is only used for mirroring, not for executing.
Should I do the mirror command with an up to date eclipse version ?

Regards,
Dirk
yes, please use the 3.2 version of eclipse to run the mirroring command. Many bugs have been fixed since 3.0.1 :-)

(In reply to comment #6)
> yes, please use the 3.2 version of eclipse to run the mirroring command. Many
> bugs have been fixed since 3.0.1 :-)

OK, with mirroring by eclipse 3.2 the error has gone. But afterwards I try to update my eclipse on the intranet with this intranet-callisto mirror and there is org.eclipse.hyades.execution.win32.x86_x4.2.0.v200606131519.jar missing.

There are a lot of org.eclipse.hyades JARs in the mirror but nothing special for linux or windows. Remember that the intranet-mirror is build on a linux platform and I use try this intranet-mirror on a windows client.

Do I have to mirror such win32 components by hand or should this mirroring tool work fine for me ?

The jar name is actually
org.eclipse.hyades.execution.win32.x86_4.2.0.v200606131519.jar

Can you look in the plugins directory of your intranet mirror and see if it exists?

> org.eclipse.hyades.execution.win32.x86_4.2.0.v200606131519.jar
> 
> Can you look in the plugins directory of your intranet mirror and see if it

>

I'd suggest running your mirroring command again and seeing if there is any error message that describes the reason why you aren't getting the missing jar.

(In reply to comment #10)
> I'd suggest running your mirroring command again and seeing if there is any

> I'd suggest running your mirroring command again and seeing if there is any

The missing hyades win32 and linux jars are now in the mirror.

There are several plugins that are included in the rcp feature, however, they don't exist on the update site.  This is because they are contributed by other teams to eclipse.org or they are built as part of the source build.  To avoid getting the "unable to retrieve remote reference" message, you should run the mirror command with the -ignoreMissingPlugins true as an argument.  

closing.
